Description: Fragment of base of Corinthian terracotta loomweight. Clay near fine yellow-buff. Two stamps, one rectangular with Greek inscription, the other oval with loomweight symbol.
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary 1884-5 (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 101a, 35 Parallels are known from the Corinthia: Perachora II 402, no 171; Corinth XII, The Minor Objects, 155, nos. 1163-5.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TF.06)
